thread.title: Granderson drives in five as Mets take lead over Dodgers
thread.title_full: Granderson drives in five as Mets take lead over Dodgers

title: Granderson drives in five as Mets take lead over Dodgers
text:
I forgot my password No thanks New York Mets' Yoenis Cespedes (52) celebrates with David Wright (5) and Daniel Murphy (28) after hitting a three-run home run during the fourth inning as Los Angeles Dodgers catcher Yasmani Grandal watches them in Game 3 of the National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, at CitiField in New York. (Frank Franklin II/Associated Press) Granderson drives in five as Mets take lead over Dodgers New York — The Associated Press 
Published Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 6:07AM EDT 
Last updated Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015 6:09AM EDT 
With big hits rather than beanballs, the New York Mets wiped out the Los Angeles Dodgers and took control of their testy Division Series. 
Curtis Granderson drove in five runs with two doubles off the wall, Travis d’Arnaud and Yoenis Cespedes homered, and New York’s dangerous bats busted loose for a 13-7 victory Monday night that gave the Mets a 2-1 advantage in the best-of-five NL playoff. connect with us The Globe and Mail Newspaper
